ns2:testcase.ns3:title: Step 5 - Run BCI Load, Part 1
ns2:testcase.ns3:description:
This is a multi-step process. There are 4 separate jobs to be run to accomplish this step. Each of the 4 separate jobs need to be run for each account type, except ILA. We don't run this for ILA's on Staging.
The files can be found at /app/dailybatch/bcifiles
To run the job replace '<Bank>' with the bank code: abt, nba, nsb, vbc, zfnb or cbt. Replace <Account Type> with DDASAV, CRL, CDIRA, or COML
If the job fails do the following before attempting to run again: Look at the logs/job data to determine why it failed. Get with a developer to help you find and fix the problem. Go to /app/dailybatch/bcifiles/<Bank>/<Account Type>. For each Account Type of each bank you'll see 4 folders: BALS, CLOSE, PRODCODES & TRANS Open the 'BALPOST' file in each folder for editing On the first line of each file you'll see a time stamp - change that timestamp value by 1. For example, if the timestamp is 20150716013516, change it to 20150716013517. Keep in mind that time stamps roll over to 00 at 59. Save the file, then move on to the next one Repeat this process for each bank, account type & folder (BALS, CLOSE, PRODCODES & TRANS) - yeah, it's a pain. Delete the sym links - see instructions in the Preconditions below.
Preconditions: Steps 1-4 need to be complete (and run successfully) before this step can be run.
Make sure there are no 'sym link' files open in /s1env/shares/zions/s1batch/data before you start. If there are, it means a job is either currently running, or got hung up in a previous run. If they exist from a previous run just delete them.
ns2:testcase.ns3:creator: rationalmigration
